column4: OK i need help with somethng easy. i found a radeon driver i think i need. it was a tar.gz. i extracted it. it says to run ./configure then make then make install. well the ./configure worked great.....now make errors. what am i doing wrong. im a noob to this
what are the errors?
i cd to the directory and then did ./configure. but when i type make, it says no target specified. im in the folder!
Is there a Makefile in there?
there are 2 a .am and a .in
i got the tar.gz from here https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/xserver-xorg-video-ati/1:6.13.0-1ubuntu5
and the configure script said it was successful
ah no. it did a bunch of stuff, but now it says requirements not met. no package xorg-server no package fontproto
so what does that mean for me? look for those packages in synaptic? or do they need to be in this folder? am i supposed to be in the root of the unzipped file, or in the /src folder?
You'll run make in the root where the Makefile is, not src. Apt-get the dependencies
You should not need to copy anything else over into the project dir
sudo apt-get install xorg-server says couldn't find package!
xserver-xorg-dev should include whatever you might need
ok, got past that part, but still not complete in the ./configure. need xf86driproto any idea where to get that? apt-get install says not found
apt-cache search xf86driproto
ok so if i did that successfully, and the make ran, but then i get a bunch of errors on make install......does that mean this driver is not for me?
you ran make and it succeeded?
nope make did NOT succeed. sorry. a bunch of struct radeon_dri has no member named....depthBits.....etcetera
me too, when you return let me know what you're trying to do
well, since updating through update manager to lucid, my video card is not working. im powerpc
was all working perfect before this update!
